com.projetloki.genesis.image

Class TextShape

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.projetloki.genesis.image.Shape
      • com.projetloki.genesis.image.TextShape
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Hashable

    public final class TextShape
extends Shape
    A shape whose interior corresponds to the rendering of a text. The shape is positioned so as the top left corner of the bounding box enclosing the rendered text is the point with coordinates (0, 0).

    The rendered text is always a single line - end of line characters are ignored. To render multiple lines of text, you must construct one text shape per line.

    Author:
    Cl√©ment Roux
    See Also:
    FontCatalog

           Font font,

        Parameters:

        font - the font to render the text with
        fontSize - the font size, in pixels. Must be positive.

      • text

      • baselineY

        public int baselineY()
        Returns the y-coordinate of the baseline. This value is measured from the top of the bounding box enclosing the rendered text. As a consequence, the result of this method doesn't depend only on the font and the font size, but also on the text itself. See the example below.

        baselineY = 32 baselineY = 39

        East Asian scripts have no baseline.

      • glyphs

        public ImmutableList<TextShape.Glyph> glyphs()
        Returns the glyphs in this text shape. In most cases there is a 1:1 mapping between glyphs and characters of the text to render, but this is not guaranteed. 

         Font font = FontCatalog.junction();
 TextShape ts = TextShape.of("Bonsoir", font, 40);
 int width = ts.width();
 int height = ts.height();
 Image redOIm = Images.canvas(width, height, Color.SCARLET_RED_3)
     .mask(ts.glyphs().get(4));
 Image im = Images.canvas(width, height, Color.ALUMINIUM_4)
     .mask(ts)
     .pasteThat(redOIm)
     .frame(Color.ALUMINIUM_1, 10, 10, 10, 10);
 Images.show(im);

      • centered

      • shrink

        public final Shape shrink(double margin)
        Description copied from class: Shape
        Returns the shape obtained by shrinking this shape, so that the distance between the boundary of each shape equals margin. If margin is negative, the shape grows instead of shrinking.
        Specified by:
        shrink in class Shape
        Parameters:
        margin - the distance between the bounds of the two shapes
